channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: Do Liverpool fans think Slot is under pressure?
item.description: After six defeats in their past seven games, BBC Sport spoke to Liverpool fans to find out what's going on this season and how they feel towards manager Arne Slot.

item.title: No McKenna Celtic talks as Bellamy commits to Wales
item.description: Ipswich Town's Kieran McKenna says he has had "no conversations" with Celtic about their managerial vacancy, while Wales head coach Craig Bellamy is committed to seeing out his team's World Cup campaign.

item.title: England's Agyemang to miss rest of season with ruptured ACL
item.description: Forward Michelle Agyemang, one of England's key players in their Euro 2025 win, has ruptured her anterior cruciate ligament.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v Football Manager, the game
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on the computer game Football Manager 26 with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: How Kane's NFL dream could become a reality
item.description: Former Kansas City Chiefs punter Dustin Colquitt tells BBC Sport why he thinks England football captain Harry Kane can fulfil his dream of becoming an NFL kicker.

item.title: Administration-hit Sheff Wed pay wages a day early
item.description: Sheffield Wednesday's administrators say players and staff have been paid their full wages a day early to end a cycle of delays.

item.title: Juventus appoint former Italy manager Spalletti
item.description: Juventus appoint former Italy head coach Luciano Spalletti as their manager until the end of the season.

item.title: How Haaland prompted a debate on drinking raw milk
item.description: BBC Sport explores Erling Haaland's lust for raw milk and the wider implications surrounding the dairy product.

item.title: Vinicius Jr no longer feels 'untouchable' - so what's going on?
item.description: Vinicius Jr no longer feels untouchable at Real Madrid and recent events are a truce, not a resolution, writes Guillem Balague.

item.title: Banishing anxiety & restoring confidence - O'Neill's Celtic return
item.description: Martin O'Neill says he overcame pre-match nerves on his Celtic return as his side beat Falkirk in the Scottish Premiership.

item.title: Premier League trio eye Etta Eyong - Friday's gossip
item.description: Premier League trio want Karl Etta Eyong, AC Milan are interested in Joshua Zirkzee loan, Manchester United are not pursuing Kevin Filling, while Chelsea lead race for Kenan Yildiz, plus more.

item.title: 'Clickbait kills everything' - Amorim and Dyche go head to head
item.description: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim and Nottingham Forest boss Sean Dyche both respond to the Englishman's comments from earlier this year that he would win more games as Red Devils manager using a 4-4-2 formation.

item.title: 'It felt like the right decision' - Slot stands by team selection
item.description: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says he has "no regrets" after making 10 changes to his team for their Carabao Cup fixture against Crystal Palace, a match they went on to lose 3-0 at Anfield.

item.title: 'I don't want to be hearing that at home' - London City confessions
item.description: London City Lionesses players including Danielle van de Donk, Jana Fernandez and Kosovare Asllani share their confessions about their team-mates in Confession Cam.

item.title: Eze and Alexander-Arnold star in best goals from last season's FA Cup
item.description: Ahead of the first round proper of this season's FA Cup, watch the very best goals from the 2024/25 competition, including Eberechi Eze's quarter-final strike against Fulham.

item.title: Wiegman 'not very positive' about Agyemang injury
item.description: England manager Sarina Wiegman says she is "not very positive" about Michelle Agyemang's injury after the forward was carried off on a stretcher during their friendly win against Australia.

item.title: Man Utd won't rush Martinez return after injury
item.description: Manchester United defender Lisandro Martinez returns to training following knee surgery, but the club will not rush him back into the fold.

item.title: Scholes stopped commentary work to care for son
item.description: Former Manchester United midfielder Paul Scholes says he stopped doing commentary work to fit his schedule around the routine of his autistic son.

item.title: How Thiaw became Newcastle's 'mentality monster'
item.description: Newcastle United broke their transfer record to sign Nick Woltemade, but another German signing has also made a big impact.

item.title: Slot 'making excuses' - but should he have rested key players?
item.description: Arne Slot got very little wrong as he guided Liverpool to the Premier League title in his first season in charge - but it is a very different story in the second.

item.title: Palace face four games in eight days
item.description: Crystal Palace are set to play Manchester City, Arsenal, KuPS and Leeds in an eight-day spell in December after reaching the Carabao Cup quarter-finals.

item.title: Last chance to vote for your BBC Women's Footballer of the Year
item.description: Vote now for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025, with the winner announced on 25 November.

item.title: Eze & Mbeumo to continue fine form - FPL team of week
item.description: There's a triple-up on Arsenal again as their imperious defence travels to promoted Burnley, while Bryan Mbeumo should continue to thrive at Nottingham Forest in the FPL team of the week.

item.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Guijarro
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Barcelona and Spain midfielder Patri Guijarro, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award.

item.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Russo
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Arsenal and England forward Alessia Russo, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award.

item.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Caldentey
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Arsenal and Spain midfielder Mariona Caldentey, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award.

item.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Hampton
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Chelsea and England goalkeeper Hannah Hampton, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award.

item.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Bonmati
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Barcelona and Spain midfielder Aitana Bonmati, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award.

item.title: 2025 BBC Women's Footballer of the Year contenders
item.description: Meet the five contenders who have been nominated for the 2025 BBC Women's Footballer of the Year award.

item.title: BBC Women's Footballer of the Year roll of honour
item.description: A roll call of who has won the Women's Footballer of the Year since it started in 2015.

item.title: Newcastle host Fulham & Cardiff face Chelsea in EFL Cup quarters
item.description: Newcastle draw Fulham in the Carabao Cup quarter-finals, while League One side Cardiff City host Chelsea.

item.title: 'Shut up and get on with it', says under-fire Saints boss Still
item.description: Under-fire Southampton head coach Will Still calls for the whole club to fight back to turn around their fortunes.

item.title: WSL2 players eligible for PFA membership
item.description: Women's Super League 2 players are eligible for Professional Footballers' Association membership after the second tier became fully professional.

item.title: Ex-Premier League chief joins Bristol City board
item.description: Bristol City appoint former Premier League chief executive Richard Scudamore to the Championship club's board of directors.

item.title: Skinner says mental health of managers 'a huge concern'
item.description: West Ham boss Rehanne Skinner knows what it's like to be in a lonely place in her job - and it is a common feeling among Women's Super League managers.

item.title: 'Tactically disciplined' Rangers 'ready' for Celtic
item.description: After back-to-back wins Danny Rohl says his "tactically disciplined" side are "ready" to face Celtic in Sunday's League Cup semi-final. But how has he inspired a turnaround?

item.title: 'Very stupid' red cards are 'embarrassing' - Maresca
item.description: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca fumes after his side get their sixth red card in nine matches despite a 4-3 win away at Wolves in the EFL Cup.

item.title: Pressure is on Wilshere in FA Cup tie - Savage
item.description: Forest Green Rovers manager Robbie Savage said the pressure is on Luton Town and new boss Jack Wilshere when they meet in the FA Cup on Friday night.

item.title: McDonnell forges ahead as a 'throwback' in football
item.description: BBC Sport looks at why Jamie McDonnell's old-school style has made the Nottingham Forest loanee an instant hit at Mansfield Town.

item.title: 'Something special' - Dowman makes history for Arsenal
item.description: Another day, another record for 15-year-old Max Dowman. But Arsenal's teenage prodigy is taking everything in his stride, according to his manager Mikel Arteta.

item.title: Who are the leading candidates for the Celtic job?
item.description: Since Brendan Rodgers resigned as Celtic manager on Monday, several candidates have emerged as the Northern Irishman's long-term successor.

item.title: Who is in the Premier League's Hall of Fame?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team lists who has been included in the Premier League's Hall of Fame and how voting works.

item.title: Pain of cup exit fuels Wrexham for Coventry test
item.description: Phil Parkinson hopes Wrexham can use the pain of their EFL Cup exit to Cardiff City as fuel for their mouthwatering contest with Championship leaders Coventry City on Friday.

item.title: Best finisher? Toughest opponent? - Shearer answers your questions
item.description: Alan Shearer answers questions from the BBC Sport audience (and Dion Dublin) on Football Focus at Newcastle's St James' Park.

item.title: Super Bowl winner offers to train Kane
item.description: Former Kansas City Chiefs punter and Super Bowl champion Dustin Colquitt says England dootball captain Harry Kane would be "fantastic" in the NFL if he decides to switch to the sport in the future and offers to coach him.

item.title: History maker Cureton on playing football at 50
item.description: Ex-Premier League striker Jamie Cureton tells Monday Night Club on his desire to still play football aged 50, after scoring his debut goal for Kings Park Rangers meaning he has scored in the top-10 tiers of English football.

item.title: Playing England 'will feel like revenge game' for Australia
item.description: Ella Toone says Tuesday's friendly against Australia "will feel like a revenge game for them" after England beat the Matildas in the 2023 World Cup semi-final in Sydney.

item.title: Real seek 'substantial damages' over Super League ruling
item.description: Real Madrid will seek "substantial damages" from Uefa after European football's governing body lost a court appeal over the failed European Super League.

item.title: 'Proud' Oxtoby says NI can improve after play-off loss
item.description: Northern Ireland manager Tanya Oxtoby says there are "areas we can really improve" but she is "proud" of her players in the Nations League play-off defeat by Iceland.

item.title: Can resolute Hearts capitalise on window of opportunity?
item.description: Hearts showed resilience to claim a point at St Mirren, but can they now build their lead over the next 10 days?

item.title: Footballer's skull fractured in spectator attack
item.description: Ormskirk West End player Richard Agbasoga was seriously hurt in after Saturday's attack.

item.title: Watch Rodgers' last interview as Celtic manager
item.description: Watch Brendan Rodgers' last interview as Celtic manager, following Sunday's 3-1 defeat by Hearts at Tynecastle.

item.title: Bellingham scores El Clasico winner
item.description: Jude Bellingham assists the first goal and scores the second for Real Madrid as they beat Barcelona 2-1 in the first Clasico of the La Liga season.

item.title: Quality and consistency of delivery key for Arsenal - Walcott
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Theo Walcott says Arsenal's quality and consistency with their set-pieces has enabled them to be so dominant.

item.title: Salah and Van Dijk have not led Liverpool - Rooney
item.description: Former England captain Wayne Rooney says Liverpool's top players are falling short - both in performance and body language - amid the club's poor run of form.

item.title: Villa took advantage of unexpected Man City team selection - Murphy
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Danny Murphy says Aston Villa too advantage of Manchester City's unexpected selection, containing no orthodox defensive midfielder.

item.title: 'Pragmatic' Spurs approach can change when players return - analysis
item.description: Theo Walcott and Danny Murphy discuss how Tottenham's set-pieces led to their win against Everton and suggest Spurs will become more creative when injured players return.

item.title: Arsenal 'suffer every week' to win matches - Arteta
item.description: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta praises Eberechi Eze's "unbelievable technique"after he scored the only goal of a tight game against Crystal Palace to extend their lead at the top of the Premier League table.

item.title: Rodgers v Desmond: Analysing the Celtic fallout
item.description: BBC Sport Scotland's chief sportswriter Tom English breaks down the public statements of Dermot Desmond and Brendan Rodgers to try to get to the bottom of the claims and counter-claims at Celtic.

item.title: Season of the set-piece - how open-play goals are falling out of fashion
item.description: Set-piece goals have been the story of the Premier League this season. BBC Sport examines their increasing importance.

item.title: Stole a penguin, jailed in Singapore, now Aberdeen sporting director
item.description: Lutz Pfannenstiel has stolen a penguin, spent 101 days in jail accused of match-fixing, modelled for Armani - and is Aberdeen's new sporting director.

item.title: When Gazzamania came to Kettering
item.description: Paul Gascoigne was one of the best English players of the last 30 years but his managerial career lasted only 39 days. BBC Sport looks back.

item.title: Chelsea's James on love of fashion & friendship with Hamilton
item.description: Reece James has progressed from the Chelsea academy to club captain, overcoming a number of injuries along the way.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Is Delap banned in Premier League after EFL Cup red card?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Chelsea striker Liam Delap will serve a Premier League suspension after being sent off in the EFL Cup.

item.title: Why are teams making substitutions in the first minute of matches?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why clubs in the National League Cup are making substitutions in the first minute of games

item.title: Is masked Premier League star allowed to play in Baller League?
item.description: BBC Sport explains the Premier League rules on whether a Premier League player can really feature in Baller League UK.

item.title: What is the Fifpro World XI?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain what the Fifpro World XI is, who votes for the award and when the winners will be announced.

item.title: What does it mean when a club enters administration?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at what it means when a club enters administration.

item.title: What is the Premier League multi-ball system?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the rules of the Premier League multi-ball system and what happened in Liverpool's defeat against Manchester United.

item.title: When did a non-Old Firm team last win a Scottish title?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the last time a team other than Rangers or Celtic won Scottish football's top flight division.

item.title: Rangers 'didn't screw up' head coach appointment
item.description: Chairman Andrew Cavenagh insists Rangers did not "screw up" the process to appoint head coach Danny Rohl but admits it looked "clunky" from the outside.

item.title: What did we learn from Rohl's Rangers unveiling?
item.description: Danny Rohl understands the need to win quickly as Rangers head coach and says he can handle pressure, as chief executive Patrick Stewart and sporting director Kevin Thelwell come under fire.

item.title: Winning & togetherness - Rohl sets out Rangers mission
item.description: Danny Rohl delivers a simple message as he is introduced as Rangers head coach, stating: "We want to win."

item.title: 'Rohl jumps from Wednesday frying pan into Rangers furnace'
item.description: Danny Rohl has taken on one of the toughest managerial jobs in world football by succeeding Russell Martin at Rangers, writes Tom English.

item.title: 'A proud club dragged into gutter'
item.description: Kevin Muscat is the latest to be ruled out of Rangers' manager search - so what do fans make of the process, and who do they want now?

item.title: Juventus sack manager Tudor after seven months
item.description: Juventus sack head coach Igor Tudor with the side eighth in Serie A after weekend defeat by Lazio.

item.title: Real Madrid impress but Vinicius tension grows - Clasico talking points
item.description: Spanish football expert Guillem Balague analyses a fiery Clasico at the Bernabeu, which saw Real Madrid beat Barcelona but Vinicius Jr vent his frustration.

item.title: How Flick has revived Rashford's career at Barcelona
item.description: How his role and the system Barcelona use is getting the best out of on-loan Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.

item.title: The rise and fall of North Korea - the sleeping giant of women's football
item.description: North Korea lags behind most of the rest of the world in several areas. But the hermit state has had an outsized impact on international women's football.
